metadata.Title: CVE-2012-2313 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The rio_ioctl function in drivers/net/ethernet/dlink/dl2k.c in the Linux kernel before 3.3.7 does not restrict access to the SIOCSMIIREG command, which allows local users to write data to an Ethernet adapter via an ioctl call. Stephan Mueller reported a flaw in the Linux kernel's dl2k network driver's handling of ioctls. An unprivileged local user could leverage this flaw to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-2313` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-1-flo - 3.4.0-1.3
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-1-goldfish - 3.4.0-1.9
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> linux-armadaxp is maintained by OEM jj> Do more research on whether the phyaddress stuff could be exploited beyond denial of service
